column4: I need to reinstall gdm, but I cannot connect to the internet to dl, and I do not have a live cd...can I mount a usb key with the package and install from terminal (sicne I have no gui)?
you should be able to use apt-get if you have the debs
so just dl them on this computer, onto usb, and run install as a normal command? or should I move them somewhere?
that would work if you can use another net connection, yes
so you only have the alternate install?
? I am not sure what you mean, I am runnign debian on a separate comp with a gui, my laptop has all of my data on it and lost gdm, and anm internet connection. No live cd...
if that is what you mean by alternate install, not sure...but I still need to find the packages
do you have a usb stick or CD to burn to?
I'm sure there is a way
what happend to the ubuntu desktop?
it's still there, but I lsot my gui
I can see all the folders in terminal but I cannot get back to it, and sudo apt-get install gdm says gnome is missing
I cannot fetch packages, internet search reveals I need cd to install select packages w/o internet
yes you just need the package list for ubuntu-desktop
